result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Rivera-Rivera

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Ruben Rivera-Rivera. Defendant Ruben Rivera-Rivera in court with Attorney Leo Martin. Attorney Olson states that the DE would like to get into CH 85.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License. Report to WCS immediately; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Kenna P-Z.  Contact allowed w/ JGBR, WM, CNRR - no alcohol, drugs or intoxicated in their presence.

01:38 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin, appeared in court.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am. $700 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). mi
and witness list filed by the State
